summary: This document consists of email correspondence among Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing the retrieval of files related to a past case involving Jeffrey Epstein. The emails highlight difficulties in locating Epstein's deposition and the implications of a protective order on the use of confidential information in the case.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is involved in the correspondence regarding the retrieval of files related to the case against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ivan Fisher
persons.context: Ivan Fisher is mentioned as a co-defendant in the case against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the case being discussed, with specific reference to his deposition and a protective order regarding financial discovery.

connections.description: Both Jeffrey Epstein and Ivan Fisher are co-defendants in the case referenced in the correspondence.

events.title: Retrieval of Court Files
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney discusses the retrieval of court files related to the case against Jeffrey Epstein and the issues encountered in locating the deposition.

events.title: Request for File Access
events.description: A request is made for access to files related to the case against Jeffrey Epstein, specifically seeking his deposition transcript.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The correspondence involves multiple Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing the retrieval of files related to the case against Jeffrey Epstein.
There is mention of a protective order that restricts the use of confidential information in the case.
The emails indicate difficulties in locating Epstein's deposition transcript.
Ivan Fisher is identified as a co-defendant alongside Jeffrey Epstein in the referenced case.
The document highlights the procedural challenges faced by the attorneys in accessing necessary case files.
